data.title: Pipeline Tool - UI - Enable build output filtering by output state
data.body:
Hi !
I just noticed, while my project is growing with more and more data, that the tool does not allow to filter output to show only errors for example. 
Scrolling among 500 items to find the 2 failures is not user-friendly.
Showing only new built items and hiding skipped ones would be nice too.

data.title: SDL window borderless setting logic is inverted.
data.body:
`window.IsBorderless = false` results in a borderless window. Likewise the reverse is true.

https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/a506f92912e44320e1962f5ee505f968a4be0c45/MonoGame.Framework/SDL/SDLGameWindow.cs#L71-L79

data.title: Feature Request: PipelineProcessor/ImporterContext.AddDependency(...) wildcards
data.body:
Example usage scenario:

You have a SpriteSheetImporter and SpriteSheetProcessor. The importer takes an xml file which lists images to combine into a sprite sheet. In some cases it is convenient to instead of listing every single file to express it as a wildcard, eg: "*.png" such that all png's in the same folder as the 'sheet.xml' are included in the sheet.

The problem is, you can later add a new png to the folder, and it does not trigger a rebuild of the sheet - because the pipeline is only watching the xml file, or if you bothered to AddDependency for each of the files it would still only be watching the files that were there the last time it was built - it still doesn't watch for -new- files which would match the wildcard.

Proposed fix:

AddDependency("*.png") ... 

This wildcard include would need to be evaluated when the pipeline is checking if a build is required. A rebuild is required if: any file in the new set is not in the prev set or has been modified since then, or if any file in the prev set is no longer in the new set.

data.title: Fix Dependencies link
Github commit error: "Could not commit submodules: ThirdParty/Dependencies"
data.body:
I got this error after syncing, fixing some conflicts, then attempting to commit to my cloned/forked MonoGame repository.

Github says:
"Add them as submodules from GitShell or remove their .git folders to add them as regular directories instead"

How do I fix it?

data.title: Pipeline fails to generate spritefont on OsX
data.body: Just setup a new project. Pipeline fails to generate spritefont from font file. It is a standart spritefont file(xml) for Arial. Try to change CharacterRegions but no luck. It is a systems default Arial and also tried with other fonts. What did I wrong? Using: - Mac - Xamarin 6.1 + MonoGame Addin v3.6.0.906 - Pipeline 3.3 (Build on 30.03.2016) From system: /Users/selimanac/Development/MonoGame/MacMonoGameTest/Content/Fonts/Arial-12.spritefont **Building Font /Library/Fonts/Arial.ttf** System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object at (wrapper unknown) SharpFont.Internal.GlyphSlotRec:PtrToStructure (intptr,object) at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal:PtrToStructure (intptr,System.Type) at SharpFont.PInvokeHelper.PtrToStructure[T](IntPtr reference) <0x10af7dc70 + 0x00032> in :0 at SharpFont.GlyphSlot.set_Reference (IntPtr value) <0x10af7fe50 + 0x0002d> in :0 at SharpFont.GlyphSlot..ctor (IntPtr reference, SharpFont.Face parentFace, SharpFont.Library parentLibrary) <0x10af7fd80 + 0x0002c> in :0 at SharpFont.Face.get_Glyph () <0x10af7fc80 + 0x0006e> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.ImportGlyph (Char character, SharpFont.Face face) <0x10af7ec30 + 0x00094> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.Import (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription options, System.String fontName) <0x10af7ca10 + 0x00161> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.ImportFont (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription options, System.Single& lineSpacing, System.Int32& yOffsetMin, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context, System.String fontName) <0x10af7c3b0 + 0x001ce> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x10af7ab20 + 0x004ea> in :0 /Users/selimanac/Development/MonoGame/MacMonoGameTest/Content/Fonts/Arial-12.spritefont: error: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. Parameter name: index From folder (Content/Fonts/Arial.ttf): /Users/selimanac/Development/MonoGame/MacMonoGameTest/Content/Fonts/Arial-12.spritefont Building Font **/Users/selimanac/Development/MonoGame/MacMonoGameTest/Content/Fonts/Arial.ttf** System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object at (wrapper unknown) SharpFont.Internal.GlyphSlotRec:PtrToStructure (intptr,object) at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal:PtrToStructure (intptr,System.Type) at SharpFont.PInvokeHelper.PtrToStructure[T](IntPtr reference) <0x1066e3c70 + 0x00032> in :0 at SharpFont.GlyphSlot.set_Reference (IntPtr value) <0x1066e5e50 + 0x0002d> in :0 at SharpFont.GlyphSlot..ctor (IntPtr reference, SharpFont.Face parentFace, SharpFont.Library parentLibrary) <0x1066e5d80 + 0x0002c> in :0 at SharpFont.Face.get_Glyph () <0x1066e5c80 + 0x0006e> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.ImportGlyph (Char character, SharpFont.Face face) <0x1066e4c30 + 0x00094> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.Import (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription options, System.String fontName) <0x1066e2a10 + 0x00161> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.ImportFont (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription options, System.Single& lineSpacing, System.Int32& yOffsetMin, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context, System.String fontName) <0x1066e23b0 + 0x001ce> in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x1066e0b20 + 0x004ea> in :0 /Users/selimanac/Development/MonoGame/MacMonoGameTest/Content/Fonts/Arial-12.spritefont: error: Index was out of range. Removed the OUYA platform

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.title: Effects destroying my project
data.body:
The problem is, that after a spritebatch begin - end (with shader), will somehow destroy every new drawing attempts (without/default shader). I've created a simple reproduction of the bug:

https://github.com/TheRealVira/BugReproduction

I'm assuming it's because "spritebatch.End()" won't end the job and doesn't clean the shader, so it'll reuse the state after another "sp.Begin()".

data.title: Set TeamCity nuget API version to v2 for development feed.
data.body: The official MonoGame development feed (http://teamcity.monogame.net/guestAuth/app/nuget/v1/FeedService.svc/) currently only offers nuget protocol v1, which makes it unusable in Visual Studio 2015 Update 1 and later where support for nuget v1 was dropped within the Nuget Package Manager. Support for nuget v2 is available in TeamCity since version 9.0 where as the current installation is 10.0 (http://teamcity.monogame.net/), so this should be only a matter of switching a single configuration (see https://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/TCD9/Configuring+TeamCity+Server+Startup+Properties#ConfiguringTeamCityServerStartupProperties-TeamCityinternalproperties and https://teamcity-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/206817105-How-to-enable-NuGet-feed-v2).

data.title: DDSLoader can now load 32-bit floating point textures.
data.body:
To fix part of http://community.monogame.net/t/32bit-dds-cubemap-to-texturecube/8151

Will need some further refactoring to load 24-bit RGB and 16-bit luminance alpha textures.

data.title: Sound effects sound like noise or are much too loud
data.body:
Some users report sound effects that sound like noise or are way too loud. 
The issue appears intermittently. I have not reproduced it and don't know what the cause is either.

This is on Windows using the default sound libraries.

I would appreciate any help on this, since I don't even know how to troubleshoot it.

data.title: DdsLoader Write Helper
data.body:
A basic uncompressed DDS writing for exporting content for use with different console command line tools.

This could be expanded in the future for other pipeline uses if needed.

data.title: Fix a crash when loading ADPCM data from a WaveBank.
data.body:
In a previous commit the code was refactored. The adjustments
to the blockAlignent was overlooked. As a result when loading
the ADPCM data under openal the blockAlignment is incorrect.
This causes a crash.

data.title: Add application icon for the Pipeline Tool (and .mgcb files)
data.body:
There are 2 icons which should be updated:
- The MonoGame Pipeline Tool icon
- .mgcb file/mime type icon

Currently both are just using the standard MonoGame logo.

data.title: OpenAL ignores loop points
data.body: As of the latest commit, if you initialize a SoundEffect with loop points in projects with OpenAL-based audio (specifically WindowsGL, I can't really test it with other systems), the loop points are straight-up ignored. I know that in 3.5.1 it threw a NotSupportedException, which seems to be a more "correct" way of dealing with that kind of thing ...

data.title: Content Pipeline Extension project fails to compile - .NET target version
data.body:
Currently in the 3.5/3.6 build. When creating a new Content Pipeline Extension project is created, it fails to build.

This is due to a .NET version compatibility from the generated template.

Simple workaround is to change the target version from .NET 4.0 to .NET 4.5.  However this should be corrected in the project template.

data.title: MediaPlayer.SetChannelVolumes() sometimes throws "Object reference not set..."
[Pipeline Tool] Updated Icons
data.body:
Stuff done:
- updates all icons in the Pipeline Tool with VS 2015 icons
- adds icons for some menu stuff (Rename, Delete, Open Item, etc.)
- Windows and Mac are using bundled icons, Linux is loading icons from the system icon theme

Screenshot:
![piptool](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/18809151/2d6b8656-8275-11e6-9ffe-e1263847957d.PNG)

data.title: Consider creating a symbolic link directory rather than copying content from targets file.
data.body:
When an mgcb item is included in a project, the build process could be:
1. Execute mgcb.exe to build the *.mgcb build script to a bin subfolder of its current location. (this is how it currently works, already).
2. Instead of copying the built content from [.mgcb location] to [project output location] - it creates a symbolic link directory.

There are details that would have to be worked out to make this actually work in all projects, but in my own project it does work ... because I have only one content project and it is located beneath Content/ and nothing else is in that folder.

data.title: Windows 10 DisplayMode null throws no suitable GraphicsDevice
data.body:
In Windows 10, if you hit the DisplayMode exception, it just tells you that there are no suitable GPUs available https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs#L219

Not sure if there's an issue for this already, I had a quick look, and didn't see it.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Use attributes if available
data.body:
Stuff done:
- properties will use `DisplayName` if available
- properties will use `DefaultValue` for the starting value if available
- properties will not be shown if `Browsable` attribute is set to false
  - under TODO I noticed there was an idea to use `ContentPipelineIgnore` (which does not exist) but we would just be creating a pointless attribute considering there already is an attribute for that exact purpose
